result.markdown: --- title: "Statistics of Statistics Graduates" author: "stesiam" description: | Extracting tabular data from PDF file, in order to explore facts about graduates of Statistics and Insurance Department in University of Piraeus link-external-newwindow: true categories: [R, EDA, PDF, tabulizer] fig-cap-location: bottom date: "2023-07-21" freeze: true image: graduation-cap.jpg df_print: paged image-alt: graduation cap toc: true toc-title: Table of contents toc-location: left citation: true slug: stesiam2022 title-block-banner: true nocite: '@*' csl: apa-6th-edition bibliography: [packages.bib, references.bib] format: html: code-link: true code-fold: false code-summary: "Show the code" code-tools: source: repo execute: echo: true editor_options: markdown: wrap: 80 --- ## Introduction Statistics can be hard. This is THe recent study guide includes data about the graduates and their average grade of graduation over the years. First and foremost the data we are interested in are included in table form (which is good) but is is part of a pdf file (which is not good :)). Thankfully, **tabulizer** is the solution to this kind of problems. ## Load Packages As I will extract tables from a pdf file, I will definitely need **tabulizer** package. Unfortunately, I was not able to install the specific package, as I was getting an error similar to this [one](https://github.com/ropensci/tabulizer/issues/157). This issue seems to be related to rJava package and [this comment](https://github.com/s-u/rJava/issues/255#issuecomment-794473988) solved the issue. After installing rJava I was able to install successufully tabulizer as below: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # remotes::install_github(c("ropensci/tabulizerjars", "ropensci/tabulizer")) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tabulizer) library(dplyr) ``` ::: ## Extract Data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} url = "https://www.unipi.gr/faculty/mbouts/anak/OS_22_23.pdf" destfile = "english/2023-07-21-Graduates-of-Statistics" ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} download.file(url, destfile = './others/') ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning in download.file(url, destfile = "./others/"): URL https://www.unipi.gr/faculty/mbouts/anak/OS_22_23.pdf: cannot open destfile './others/', reason 'Is a directory' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning in download.file(url, destfile = "./others/"): download had nonzero exit status ``` ::: ::: ## Analysing Data ## Acknowledgements {.appendix .unlisted} Dataset based on recent study guide recent study guide of Department of Statistics and Insurance Science of the University of Piraeus. Image by Victoria Loveland from Pixabay ## References {.appendix .unlisted}
